tips.title: Travel Tips in Korea
tips.subtitle: What would you like to know?

payment.title: Payment Guide
list: Most shops, restaurants, and convenience stores accept international cards (VISA, Mastercard, JCB, UnionPay, etc.).
Markets, small restaurants, and rural areas may not accept cards, so it's recommended to carry some cash.

emergency.title: How to Use Emergency Numbers 112/119

list: Report crimes, traffic accidents, lost items
Use for fire, emergency medical, rescue situations
Automatic location tracking when you call

emergency.additionalTipContent: 1330 is a 24/7 multilingual tourist helpline operated by the Korea Tourism Organization. In emergencies, it can provide interpretation support through a three-way call with 112 or 119.

transportCard.title: How to Use Transportation Cards (eZL, T-money)
rechargeableCardList: Most widely used transportation cards in Korea. Buy once and recharge multiple times.
Where to buy: convenience stores (GS25, CU, 7-Eleven, Emart24, etc.)
Usable on subways, buses, airport trains, and some taxis
Compatible in most areas including Seoul, Busan, Jeju
Can be recharged with cash only
Remaining balance can be refunded at some convenience stores minus a fee
Can be used at some convenience stores
Transfer discounts available between bus and subway
transportCard.rechargeableCardRecommendation: Best option if you plan to use public transport multiple times.

ezl.title: eZL
list: IC type: includes payment chip, usable for general purchases
RF type: no chip, usable only for public transport and some convenience stores
If registered on eZL site, balance can be refunded when reported lost

tmoney.title: T-money
list: RF type: no chip, usable only for public transport and some convenience stores
If registered on T-money site, balance can be refunded when reported lost

singleUseTicketList: One-time-use card for Seoul subway only
Can be purchased from ticket machines inside subway stations
Includes a 500 KRW deposit (e.g., 1,250 fare + 500 deposit = 1,750 total)
Refundable 500 KRW at deposit return machines at your destination station
transportCard.singleUseTicketRecommendation: Useful if you're using the subway just once or twice!

embassy.title: Embassy Contacts (by Country)
embassy.description: Contact info and addresses of major embassies in Korea. You can seek help in case of loss, accidents, or emergencies.
embassy.noteContent: Embassies operate on weekdays only. In case of emergency, you can reach them via emergency contact numbers.

hospital.title: Finding Hospitals & Pharmacies + Location Info
pharmacyList: You can buy basic medicine (like cold medicine) at pharmacies, but antibiotics require a doctor‚Äôs prescription.
Most pharmacies offer basic English communication.
Some convenience stores also sell basic medication.
foreignerFriendlyList: Seoul National University Hospital: English, Chinese, Japanese support
Yonsei Medical Center: Operates an international clinic
Samsung Medical Center: Foreigners-only reception desk
Asan Medical Center: Provides interpretation service
mainHospitalsList: Information on hospitals with foreigner services is currently being updated. In emergencies, call 119 for transport to the nearest ER.

ÏÑúÏö∏.title: A City Where Tradition and Modernity Coexist
ÏÑúÏö∏.description: As the capital of South Korea, Seoul is the center of culture, economy, and politics. It's a city where you can experience a diverse range of attractions all in one day, from ancient palaces and traditional Hanok villages to modern shopping malls and skyscrapers.

Í≤ΩÍ∏∞.title: Diverse Charms Embracing the Capital Area
Í≤ΩÍ∏∞.description: Surrounding Seoul, Gyeonggi Province offers a wide variety of destinations, from the UNESCO World Heritage Suwon Hwaseong Fortress to modern cities and beautiful natural recreation forests. Enjoy both dynamic city tours and peaceful relaxation in nature.

Ïù∏Ï≤ú.title: Gateway City Where Sky Meets Sea
Ïù∏Ï≤ú.description: Home to Incheon International Airport, the gateway to Korea. It offers unique experiences where past and future coexist, featuring beautiful islands of the West Sea, a historic Chinatown from the port's opening era, and the futuristic skyline of Songdo International City.

Í∞ïÏõê.title: A Haven of Clean Nature Painted by Mountains and Sea
Í∞ïÏõê.description: Boasting a natural paradise where majestic mountain ranges like Seoraksan and Odaesan meet the blue East Sea. You can enjoy leisure sports all year round and experience perfect healing amidst clean air and a tranquil atmosphere.

Î∂ÄÏÇ∞.title: City of Sea, Film, and Romance
Î∂ÄÏÇ∞.description: South Korea's second-largest city and largest port. From the vast Haeundae and Gwangalli beaches and Jagalchi Market full of fresh seafood to the Busan Cinema Center where international film festivals are held, the city's romance is endless.

ÎåÄÍµ¨.title: A Fashionable City Full of Passion and Youth
ÎåÄÍµ¨.description: Once the center of the textile industry, Daegu has transformed into a city leading Korea's cultural trends. Feel the vibrant energy of Daegu on the lively streets of Dongseongno, the nostalgic Kim Kwang-seok Street, and within the beautiful nature of Palgongsan Mountain.

Í¥ëÏ£º.title: The Home of Arts, Democracy, and Flavor
Í¥ëÏ£º.description: Known as the 'Home of Arts' and a sacred site for Korean democracy. Gain artistic inspiration from the world-renowned Gwangju Biennale and the Asia Culture Center, and complete your culinary journey with rich Namdo cuisine.

ÎåÄÏ†Ñ.title: The Science City Opening Korea's Future
ÎåÄÏ†Ñ.description: The heart of South Korea's science and technology, home to the Daedeok Innopolis and KAIST. It's a city of intellectual charm where you can explore the mysteries of science at the National Science Museum and enjoy urban leisure at Hanbat Arboretum.

Ïö∏ÏÇ∞.title: The Heart of Industry, Breathing with Nature
Ïö∏ÏÇ∞.description: A global hub for the automotive and shipbuilding industries that also boasts a beautiful ecological environment. Stroll through the bamboo forest at Taehwagang National Garden, meet whales at Jangsaengpo, and greet the earliest sunrise at Ganjeolgot Cape.

ÏÑ∏Ï¢Ö.title: The Smart Administrative Capital, Center of a Relaxed Life
ÏÑ∏Ï¢Ö.description: As the new administrative heart of South Korea, Sejong is a young and well-planned smart city. Centered around Sejong Lake Park, the largest man-made lake in Asia, it offers abundant green spaces for a pleasant and leisurely city trip.

Ï∂©Î∂Å.title: An Inland Jewel of Lakes and Mountains
Ï∂©Î∂Å.description: Though without a sea, its beautiful lakes like Chungjuho and Daecheongho captivate the heart. It's the perfect destination to admire the stunning scenery of Woraksan and Songnisan National Parks and to spend a peaceful time at the serene Beopjusa Temple.

Ï∂©ÎÇ®.title: Where the Spirit of Baekje and the Romance of the West Sea Reside
Ï∂©ÎÇ®.description: As the center of the brilliant Baekje culture, numerous historical sites remain in Gongju and Buyeo. You can enjoy the world-famous Boryeong Mud Festival and savor the tranquil romance of the West Sea while driving along the beautiful coastline of Taean.

Ï†ÑÎ∂Å.title: A Land of Plenty Where Korean Flavor and Style Come Alive
Ï†ÑÎ∂Å.description: From the classic beauty and rich cuisine of Jeonju Hanok Village to the breathtaking autumn foliage of Naejangsan Mountain. It is one of the best-preserved places of Korean tradition and natural beauty, promising a fulfilling journey that satisfies all five senses.

Ï†ÑÎÇ®.title: The Southern Land of Indigo Seas and Green Plains
Ï†ÑÎÇ®.description: A place of impressive scenery, featuring the jewel-like islands of the Dadohae archipelago and the green waves of the Boseong Green Tea Fields. It is the ultimate healing destination where you can experience the aesthetics of slowness while savoring the best of Korean cuisine.

Í≤ΩÎ∂Å.title: The Cradle of Silla History and Confucian Culture
Í≤ΩÎ∂Å.description: The root of Korean spiritual culture, embracing the ancient capital Gyeongju and Andong, where the spirit of the seonbi (scholar) lives on. Experience tradition at Hahoe Village and enjoy a romantic drive along the majestic coastline of the East Sea.

Í≤ΩÎÇ®.title: Where the Scenic Beauty of the South Sea Meets High-Tech Industry
Í≤ΩÎÇ®.description: Filled with the picturesque scenery of Hallyeohaesang National Park and beautiful islands like Geoje, Tongyeong, and Namhae. It is a region of diverse charms, where you can feel the majesty of Jirisan Mountain and explore the planned urban beauty of Changwon.

Ï†úÏ£º.title: The Mysterious Island Forged by a Volcano
Ï†úÏ£º.description: South Korea's largest island and a shining UNESCO World Natural Heritage site. It is the ultimate vacation destination, offering unforgettable impressions to all visitors with Hallasan Mountain, numerous volcanic cones (oreum), and emerald beaches.
